turns.content: What are the most common types of virtual reality headsets available on the market today?

1. Oculus Rift: This is a popular VR headset developed by Oculus VR. It has a high-resolution display and provides an immersive VR experience.

2. HTC Vive: This is a VR headset developed by HTC and Valve Corporation. It features motion tracking and hand controllers, making the experience more interactive and realistic.

3. PlayStation VR: This is a VR headset developed by Sony for use with the PlayStation 4 gaming console. It provides an affordable and user-friendly VR experience.

4. Samsung Gear VR: This is a mobile VR headset that uses a Samsung smartphone as the display. It is affordable and easy to use.

5. Google Cardboard: This is a simple, low-cost VR headset made of cardboard that uses a smartphone as the display.

6. Windows Mixed Reality Headsets: These are VR headsets developed by Microsoft that use inside-out tracking technology, making them easy to set up and use. 

7. Pimax: This headset features an ultra-wide field of view and high resolution display. 

8. Valve Index: This VR headset comes with finger-tracking controllers and higher refresh rates for a more immersive experience.
